Title: CAD Design
Content: A lot of my projects require 3D printing, which requires CAD design. I have a little experience in Fusion360 but I switched to Onshape recently.

Title: 3D Printing
Content: I'm sort of a novice when it comes to the settings you can mess with, but I do have experience maintaining and repairing 3D printers.

Title: Robotics
Content: I have experience with microcontrollers on the smaller side, like the ESP32 or Arduino Nano, which I have used for smaller robotics projects.

Title: Soldering
Content: I am experienced with soldering from my various projects, and I am able to produce mostly clean joints.

Title: Project Organization & Tracking
Content: With all the projects I have made, I have learned how to keep track of my projects with applications like Trello, Miro, and Figma.

Title: Troubleshooting
Content: Of course with anything, errors or problems will occur, and with that I've learned multiple troubleshooting and debugging strategies.

Title: Programming in Lua
Content: Lua was one of my very first languages, which I learned from Roblox Studio when I was young. It taught me the essential logic needed for programming.

Title: Programming in C#
Content: C# is one of my most known langauges as it is quite versitile, I have used it for making applications, modding games, and creating games.

Title: Programming in C++
Content: I have only used C++ for programming microcontrollers, so I've never had to mess with the STD namespace, instead I use a dumbed down veesion with Arduino.

Title: Programming in Python
Content: I have used Python for parsing through text files to pull information out and analyzing images to detect movement.

Title: Programming in Java
Content: I am currently in a CCP class which covers Java, but I consider myself experienced as it is similar to C# and I have distinguished the differences.

Title: Programming in HTML/CSS
Content: I took a web-dev class in my Sophomore year of highschool which is where I started making websites like this.
